thread.title_full: Baidu Names Lenovo Chairman, Former Uber CFO as Board Directors - Bloomberg Business

author: Tim Culpan
title: Baidu Names Lenovo Chairman, Former Uber CFO as Board Directors
text:
Baidu Inc. named the chairman of the world’s largest personal-computer maker to its board of directors as China’s largest search-engine provider looks offline for future growth.
Yang Yuanqing, chairman of Lenovo Group Ltd., and former Uber Technologies Inc. Chief Financial Officer Brent Callinicos will join Baidu’s board effective Thursday. Former Sony Corp. Chairman Nobuyuki Idei and Netdragon Websoft Inc. Chairman Liu Deijian will step down, Beijing-based Baidu said Wednesday.
Baidu, which earns virtually all its profit from online search, is investing in online-to-offline ventures, including home delivery and the China unit of car-hailing service Uber. Founder and Chairman Robin Li has said he’s willing to dip into the company’s $12 billion in cash to help persuade consumers to use its platform connecting online search with offline services.
Baidu has invested at least $5 billion into outside ventures, including discount site Nuomi Holdings Inc. and laundry app Edaixi, since 2011.
